Write on a banana peel - The banana peel can be used as a makeshift writing surface by using a piece of chalk or a marker to draw your letters or words.
Use sandpaper - Sandpaper can be used as a writing surface by drawing your letters or words onto it with a pen or pencil.
Write in the dirt - If you're in an outdoor setting, you could use the dirt as a writing surface by digging a shallow hole and placing a piece of paper in it to write on.
Use a piece of glass - You could also use a piece of glass as a writing surface by drawing your letters or words onto it with a pen or pencil.
Use a stone - A smooth stone can be used as a writing surface by rubbing your fingers across it to create indentations that can be filled with ink or paint.
